channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024031394
item.description:
Report X-2024031394

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: LA CROSSE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Bucket containing UN1760 started leaking from bottom of drum due to small crack that formed in the center. DescribePack: Crack formed on bottom of drum in the center, crack is less than 1 millimeter DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA used PPE to put leaking bucket in hazmat bin and put down ANPHOMAG Universal spill neutralizer on released liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024031274
item.description:
Report X-2024031274

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: EAU CLAIRE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was inbound scanned at 06:30. By 06:34 package arrived in primary sort tower. Individual in primary sort tower communicated that a hazmat had been sent up, and that box had a strong smell to it. Upon inspection liquid was found within containment bag. DescribePack: Unable to determine exact size of opening, but damage was done to top rim of metal container, resulting in leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tip package upright, liquid was leaking out of top.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found on a QA cart leaking. Box was placed in a bin with a plastic liner to contain spillage. DescribePack: One of four 4L bottles had a loose cap and spilled contents into package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin with a plastic liner to contain the spillage.

item.title: Report I-2023120064
item.description:
Report I-2023120064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: NELSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAU CLAIRE CO OPERATIVE OIL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 110010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Tank vehicle was traveling 35 mph in a 55 mph zone, on a rural paved road. Driver was pealing a banana when the vehicle left the paved portion of the roadway, entered the soft fhoulder of the road, was pulled into the ditch and rolled. As time passed and the vehicle lay on its passenger side, diesel fuel began to trickel from the releif vents on the fill port covers. Approximately two gallons of fuel was released from the cargo tank of which approximately 2 cups reached the enviorment. Two shovels full of contaminated soil were removed from the scene and placed in a diesel fuel waste barrel for proper disposal.
